channel.title: Iiyama vs Samsung
channel.description: Which TFT-Display producer is better, Iiyama or Samsung? What are the differences if any? Which one has the better support?

item.title: Iiyama vs Samsung
item.dc:creator: ericgraham
item.description:
I will vote for the samsung, never had a problem with a Samsung product, but I have a TV and a LCD monitor 19 "as perfect in every way. Generally less expensive than illyama too.

Read full topic

item.description:
I would really try to see them in operation. Otherwise, see the specifications and see which one fits the type of use. Trying to find out which gives the best performance and experience.

item.title: Iiyama vs Samsung
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
ok, thanks.
Well I want to buy the Samsung SyncMaster P2450H 24".
I heard it’s pretty good but I also heard it makes annoying noises, but only a few people complain about that noises problem and also a few people complain about a poor image quality when using HDMI, but most people say it looks fine…

Read full topic

item.title: Iiyama vs Samsung
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
go for the newest one, my friend has one of the older samsung 1200 line TFT LCD’s and it’s got loads of problems like sometimes it shows garbage, has poor brightness/black levels, lots of backlight bleeding/nonexistent viewing angle and it makes cracking noises breaking the silence all the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Iiyama vs Samsung
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
I trust Samsung, because I have a Samsung (non-TFT) LCD monitor that compares very favorably compared to a Dell it neighbors.

I have zero experience with iiyama, and TFT displays in general, but I can tell you that when my Samsung developed a stuck column of pixels last year (a month or two after I got it, I believe its quality is covered for a minimum of 3 months), I sent it in for repair, and got it back in perfect working order, in less than a week. Smooth sailing ever since.

Read full topic
